availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Brassale (Alabama blacksmith + pvt 1st Ky Light Artillery)

body.p: Blount County, Alabama, blacksmith and Kentucky soldier. Blount County, Alabama native. Married to Frances D. Reno Brassale in Lebanon, Kentucky, on February 19, 1864. Blacksmith in 1864. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as corporal, farrier and blacksmith, and private from September 10, 1863. Reported as deserted from Lexington, Kentucky, on October 18, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Marion County Marriages, Film #000597424, p. 91.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 510, 520.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0147.
